pullRequest.title: Variable equipment size
pullRequest.bodyText:
Companion to MegaMek/megamek#1902
Adds another field to EquipmentPart and MissingEquipmentPart to track size of variable-sized equipment.

commit.message:
Added size field to EquipmentPart and MissingEquipmentPart.

Removed capacity field from LargeCraftAmmoBin to use size field instead.
Use size field when setting EquipmentPart name.
Fix Drone carrier control system and MASH equipment part costs.

nodes.bodyText: Strings are always escaped, so no need to call it here.
Why is there no setter for size?

Why even keep these, or at least not deprecate them?
Just temporary cause you don't want to make the change now to remove them? Or is it because they is no setter for size?

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                                    epart = new EquipmentPart((int)entity.getWeight(), type, eqnum, m.getSize(),
          
          
            
                                    epart = new EquipmentPart((int) entity.getWeight(), type, eqnum, m.getSize(),
Same as equipment part, why not include a set size?
Should the two == comparisons be bracketed? Asking as that's part of our coding style guide I've never been certain on for return values
Same as the non-missing part, why leave these in or not deprecate them?
